title: 106_hr2589
content:
SECTION 1. TRANSFER TO A PRIVATE CORPORATION. All property of the Postal Service will be transferred to a corporation if it meets the requirements within 1 year of the enactment of this Act. The plan must ensure no payment is required for any transferred rights or assets.

SEC. 2. REQUIREMENTS FOR THE CORPORATION. A corporation must meet specific requirements to take over the Postal Service, including being incorporated under state laws, not being a government entity, having a board of not more than 9 qualified individuals chosen by Postal Service employees, and delivering postal services in line with established regulations. The corporation taking over the Postal Service must issue securities to employees in a manner determined by the Postal Privatization Commission and provide comparable retirement benefits to employees transferring from the Postal Service. SEC. 3. TRANSFER PLAN; PRESIDENTIAL DETERMINATION; RATE-SETTING AUTHORITY. The President must submit a transfer plan within 60 days of a corporation meeting certain requirements, outlining the orderly transfer of property within 180 days and recommending legislation, including the abolishment of the Postal Service. The President determines the date a corporation meets requirements. Proposals for postage rate-setting during the first 5 years may include continuing Postal Rate Commission operations. SEC. 4. POSTAL PRIVATIZATION COMMISSION. Establishment of the Postal Privatization Commission with 9 members selected by the President to represent various interests. Members shall be compensated for their service. The Commission members will be paid a daily rate not exceeding the level IV of the Executive Schedule. Full-time US officers or employees on the Commission will not receive additional pay. The Commission will terminate once its work is completed. The definitions outlined in the Act include the United States Postal Service, property related to the Postal Service, the term "State" referring to various regions, and the Postal Privatization Commission.
